Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a deep double-convex body, a long round-topped nozzle with a rounded end, a circular slightly raised base-ring defined by a groove, and a small plain depressed discus with a moulded rim. The wick-hole is surrounded by a flat circular rim. The shoulder is decorated with concentric semicircles and rows of beads. On top of the nozzle is a palmette. Impressed within the base-ring is the letter beta. Traces of a buff slip (?) remain.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q565)
Acquisition name: Donated by: G C W Bennett
